Useful in SSR. Basically the queries that a given UI runs when it displays a page can be recorded and it's output can be saved for quick display of that page later - in an SSR environment or even on the client device. So, instead of having to go through loading several repositories and then progressively constructing the view, it can be composed with a single data call and no data processing at all. This works really well for immutable views but also works for views where data changes. For example when the data does change the combintation of all data that is provied to the UI can be diffed against the previous version. If it's different it can be updated. This can be easily done in a server environment that will crawl the data and have the permission to update the Versioned View data result.
